episode_summary: This episode features discussions on the unknown effects of smartphones on children, the history of a flying aircraft carrier, an ultra-marathon in New York, and a study on people's preferences for lottery winnings.

facts.fact: My favorite fact is that no one has any clear idea about what growing up with a smartphone does.
My fact is that in 1931, the USA launched an aircraft carrier which itself could fly.
My fact this week is that there is a marathon in New York that takes so long to complete, runners can go through up to 20 pairs of shoes while they're trying to run it.
My fact this week is that, given the choice, most people would prefer to win $10 million rather than $100 billion.
